comments:
I suddenly stopped being able to build classes in eclipse a few days ago. I have tried cleaning and rebuilding, opening and closing the project, opening and closing eclipse, touching java files, manually removing the classes directory, changing the project output folder, build project automatically, etc. I sometimes see the little worker box pop up and a "rebuilding project" message with a %complete, and no errors. Some, but not all the classes are rebuilt. 

I do see some interesting messages in the .metadata/log file, which look like eclipse is having difficulty writing its own history and/or resource files. I don't see where to attach the log file in this bug report form though, so I am attaching the most recent entry:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 272 Feb 02, 2007 15:13:34.746
!MESSAGE Indexed store transactions did not commit properly: C:\ATG\ATG7.0\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\.history\.index.
!STACK 0

Created an attachment (id=58290)
log file showing problems writing history and resources

It looks like a permissions problem on your disk:

java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\ATG\ATG7.0\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\.history\.index.log (Access is denied)

Can you write to that location?  I also recommend upgrading to a newer release if you can - Eclipse 3.0 is approaching three years old, and we generally do not investigate or fix bugs in such an old release. I suggest moving to Eclipse 3.2.1 if you can (or 3.2.2 due later this month).

I can write to this directory - however, when I try to create a file name .index.log, windoze complains "You must type a file name". I can create the file via the command line prompt or cygwin however.
